Package it.unipr.sowide.actodes.actor

Class Actor

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unipr.sowide.actodes.actor.Actor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActiveActor, ExecutorActor, PassiveActor, ProviderActor
    public abstract class Actor
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The Actor class provides a partial implementation of an actor.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Adds a message in the mailbox.

      • future

        public void future​(Reference a,
                   java.lang.Object c,
                   MessageHandler h)
        Sends a two-way message to another actor. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
        Parameters:
        a - the destination reference.
        c - the message content.
        h - the reply processing handler. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the destination is not reachable or cannot manage the message.

      • future

        public void future​(Reference a,
                   java.lang.Object c,
                   long t,
                   MessageHandler h)
        Sends a two-way message to another actor. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
        Parameters:
        a - the destination reference.
        c - the message content.
        t - the reply reception timeout.
        h - the reply processing handler. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the destination is not reachable, cannot manage the message or the timeout fires before the reception of the reply.

      • future

        public void future​(Message m,
                   java.lang.Object c,
                   MessageHandler h)
        Sends a two-way message as reply to an another message. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
        Parameters:
        m - the message to be replied.
        c - the message content.
        h - the reply processing handler. Note that the message is sent only if the incoming message requires an answer. if the incoming message does not require an answer, then an error message is logged. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the destination is not reachable or cannot manage the message.

      • future

        public void future​(Message m,
                   java.lang.Object c,
                   long t,
                   MessageHandler h)
        Sends a two-way message as reply to an another message. This kind of message requires a reply, but the sender does not stop itself for waiting for the reply.
        Parameters:
        m - the message to be replied.
        c - the message content.
        t - the reply reception timeout.
        h - the reply processing handler. Note that the message is sent only if the incoming message requires an answer. if the incoming message does not require an answer, then an error message is logged. Note that the reply can be also an error message if the destination is not reachable, cannot manage the message or the timeout fires before the reception of the reply.

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive​(MessagePattern p,
                      MessageHandler h)
        Processes an incoming message that satisfies a specific message pattern.
        Parameters:
        p - the message pattern.
        h - the message processing handler. Note that the actor does not stop itself for waiting for the message. Moreover, such a message pattern - message handler pair manages a single message (i.e., it is removed after the processing of a message).

      • onReceive

        public void onReceive​(MessagePattern p,
                      long t,
                      MessageHandler h)
        Processes either an incoming message that satisfies a specific message pattern or an error message if the timeout fires.
        Parameters:
        p - the message pattern.
        t - the message reception timeout.
        h - the message processing handler. Note that the actor does not stop itself for waiting for the message. Moreover, such a message pattern - message handler pair manages a single message (i.e., it is removed after the processing of a message).

        Shutdowns the actor.
